New Records: Chris Jordan became the first English player to take a hat-trick at a T20 World Cup
Key Match Events: Chris Jordan hat-trick and Jos Buttler blast earn win
JOS BUTTLER HAS JUST HIT FIVE SIXES IN AN OVER!
Chris Jordan takes a hat-trick in 4 balls
Pre-Game Insights: Some of these calculations might be false: England need to get 116 in 17.4 overs to qualify outright for the semis
Post-Match Reflections: Jos Buttler is a happy man.
Jos Buttler says England were aware of the calculations and wanted to give themselves every chance of topping the group.
Jos Buttler pays tribute to the bowling depth at his disposal, particularly Livingstone and Rashid today.
A word on Chris Jordan? A World Cup hat-trick is a great effort.” Crikey – wind down the hyperbole eh Jos!
Adil Rashid is named player of the match.
Adil Rashid says: All the bowlers bowled extremely well, to restrict them to 115 was very pleasing.
Adil Rashid on Chris Jordan: CJ’ is a match-winner. He’s been doing it for a number of years now, especially at the back end.
Miscellaneous Highlights: England are the first defending champions to reach a men's T20 World Cup semi-final in a decade
USA captain Aaron Jones: It is a hard game to get to grips with! We’ve not had a good last two games… but we’ve really enjoyed this tournament.
USA captain Aaron Jones: This is our first World Cup. I don’t think people would have thought we’d be playing here against the big boys. Hopefully this will open the eyes of the American public.
